did.abstract: Chiefly letters to Captain Down in England, from a few men in Charleston, S.C., who were evidently employed to assist in settling a dispute involving W.J. Somers's estate. Somers was Down's father-in-law and lived in the Charleston area. There is also information relating to Down's brother, who was living in South Carolina, and a letter from one of Down's nieces to her aunt in England.
